suggestions.title: Fevers: Symptoms, Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
suggestions.description: What is a fever? Learn why fevers occur, how to check your temperature, when you should be concerned about a fever, and how to treat it.

suggestions.title: Q fever: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment
suggestions.description: Q fever is a bacterial infection typically spread to humans through contact with animals, particularly livestock. Learn how it may affect you.

suggestions.title: What to Do If Your Baby Has a Fever
suggestions.description: Your baby has a fever? No need to panic (usually)! Here's everything you need to know.

suggestions.title: When Does Fever After Surgery Become a Concern?
suggestions.description: Are you concerned about a fever after surgery? Find out if your temperature or fever is normal, and what you should do about it.

suggestions.title: Yellow Fever: Overview and More
suggestions.description: Yellow fever is a viral illness spread by mosquitos endemic to Africa and South America. Reviewed by a board-certified infectious disease physician.

suggestions.title: Understanding Fever in Children
suggestions.description: Understanding fever can help combat fever phobia and teach parents when it is appropriate to treat a child's fever with a fever reducer.

suggestions.title: Low-Grade Fever: Definition, Causes, Treatments
suggestions.description: You have a low-grade fever when your body temperature is between 99.6 to 100.3 F, although some put it higher. Viruses and bacteria cause most fevers.

suggestions.title: Pel-Ebstein Fever Diagnosis and Patterns
suggestions.description: Pel-Ebstein fever, a particularly abrupt and cycling fever pattern, is recognized as a potential sign of Hodgkin lymphoma and other conditions.

suggestions.title: Periodic Fever Syndromes: Overview and More
suggestions.description: Periodic fever syndromes are a group of diseases that cause fevers unexplained by infection. These conditions are often passed down through families.

suggestions.title: Kids’ Fever: When to Go to the Doctor
suggestions.description: Kids’ fevers can be scary, especially if your child is a baby or toddler or has other symptoms. Here’s when to call the doctor for a child’s fever.
